subject: Travel
title: Arab Coffee Ceremonies
description: A 60-second lesson on Arab Coffee Ceremonies.

hook.text: In the Arabian Peninsula, refusing coffee from a host is a serious insult. You must accept at least one cup.

buildup.text: Arabic coffee is brewed with cardamom and poured from a long-spouted pot called a dallah.

discovery.text: The host pours with the left hand and serves with the right. Cups are only filled one-third full.

twist.text: To signal you've had enough, you tilt the cup side to side. Simply saying 'no' is not polite enough.

climax.text: UNESCO added Arabic coffee culture to its Intangible Cultural Heritage list in 2015.

punchline.text: A half-empty cup says more than words ever could.

quiz.question: How do you signal you've had enough Arabic coffee?
options: Cover the cup with your hand
Tilt the cup side to side
